value.name: Colombia's Duque Says He’s Deploying Military to Protest-hit Cali
value.description: Colombian President Ivan Duque announced Friday he was deploying military troops to Cali, at the epicenter of bloody anti-government protests across the country that have left dozens dead over the past month.

value.name: No impunity for police officers responsible for abuse says Colombia's top cop
value.description: The head of Colombia's National Police Force General Jorge Luis Vargas has said that officers who are responsible for abuses or acts of violence amid ongoing protests will be punished to the full extent of the law.

value.name: The anger driving Colombia's protest movement isn't going away anytime soon
value.description: What started as a tax reform proposal to help ease the strain of the pandemic on the economy and balance government finances ended with people taking to the streets to express their discontent.

value.name: Colombia Strikes Clan del Golfo Structures
value.description: The military siege against leaders of criminal groups in Colombia continues to show positive results. Structures of the Clan del Golfo have suffered major blows. On March 24, 2021, Colombian Minister of Defense Diego Molano announced simultaneous operations that led to the capture of 25 Clan del Golfo members in Chocó department.
